intro: Rubus × scrupeiformis, commonly known as the roughleaf blackberry, is a hybrid species within the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits that typically range in color from red to black. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its edible berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along the edges of forests. The leaves are usually rough to the touch, giving the plant its common name.
